column4: so I have a command I want to execute from nautilus-actions   I need it to be run on all files inside folders and subfolders but not the folders themselves.    %M doesn't seem to work does anyone have any more suggestions?
find
'find' is a command
yes I know but I need a parameter not a command :)  its for nautilus-actions
pass 'find'  the top-level directory and use -type and -exec
yes thanks but I am trying to use nautilus actions to do this so I can right click a folder and execute the command without brining up cli
thanks anyway
yes I know... this should work
ok so I put -type -exec into the parameters option in nautilus-actions?
in some form
you know shred is useless on ext3?
according to the manual it works fine on ext as long as you don't use data=journaled mode
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/39762/  read for yourself
right
make sure you test with some user that has no important files

how did you set it up
just as it said in the article.
paste here what you input in nautilus actions

you could create a confirmation dialog with zenity maybe
